result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Devonte J Morales was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
All payments are ordered to be paid to the BURNETT COUNTY CLERK OF COURT'S OFFICE.  The defendant has thirty (30) days to make first payment of $100, and then $100/mo with the Clerk of Court's office. Make checks or money orders payable to "BURNETT COUNTY" and send to: Burnett County Clerk of Court, 7410 Cty. Rd. K,  #115, Siren, WI 54872.    

Payments may be made either in person, by mail, or online either through wicourts.gov or through paygov.us. (subject to each website's processing fees).
Must install ignition interlock for all owned vehicles - to be installed when defendant applies for a license.
Defendant will have credit for any administrative suspension previously imposed.
Defendant shall complete an OWI Assessment and Driver Safety Plan and follow all recommendations.
Defendant is eligible for good time.  Defendant is allowed to do electronic monitor, if pre-paid and scheduled with IDIP Coordinator.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devonte J Morales

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt:
3:26 PM Called 22CM16 set for PLEAS.  Defendant Devonte J Morales in court.  Attorney Kate Mary Murtaugh in court for Devonte J Morales.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attny Murtaugh updates the court, about 7 days jail credit, def did IDIP type program in Polk County.  State notes no bond filed so not sure how def could have jail credit. Court notes no GF to have a BBH.  Def wishes to proceed today.  Case is on for Plea/Sentencing Hearing. Court reviews min and max penalties with def.  Asking for IDIP guidelines after taking similar program in Polk Co. Court asks def if he reviewed the criminal complaint with his Attny, def confirms, court asks if we may use the PC statement for a factual basis.  Attny Murtaugh confirms. 
Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  Court reviews Def's constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.  Court asks for plea. 
 Def enters a plea of Guilty to OWI 2nd, count 1.  Court finds def is making plea knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of OWI 2nd, count 2 merged, count 3 DRI and orders a JOC.  DA notes BAC is .12 and asks Court to accept IDIP guidelines, has emailed jail about jail credit, would not be opposed if def can pre-pay for electronic monitor.  Defense attorney makes argument, asks Court to accept joint recommendation for guidelines.  Def does make a statement to the Court, has completed program.  

Court Orders: 
Fine of $876, def to pay $100/month, may petition the court for a financial review hearing if can't meet the $100/mo.
12 month IID
12 month DL revoked
5 days jail, 4 days to sit with good time.  Will hear back next week on jail credit, once we get that Court can update the JOC, if def doesn't have enough jail credit he would be allowed to do electronic monitor with Ms. Tessa Anderson, $18/day and need to schedule ahead of time.
OWI Assessment and Driver Safety Plan and follow all recommendations

A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 

Appeal rights provided.  DNA to be provided to the Sheriff before leaving the building.

10:10 AM Called 22CM16 for STC.  Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Devonte J Morales in court.  Attorney Kate Mary Murtaugh appeared by video for Devonte J Morales. Attny Murtaugh updates the court.  Bond continues.  Def ok with Attny appearing by zoom. Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 13, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference on August 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.

09:59 AM Defendant, Devonte J Morales, appeared with Attorney Kate Mary Murtaugh.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for the State.  Devonte J Morales appeared with Attorney by Zoom audio means.  Case on for Status Conference.  Defense attorney updates the Court: def wrapping up programming, requesting additional status.  Status conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Status conference on May 26, 2022 at 09:45 am.

09:58 AM Defendant, Devonte J Morales, appeared with Attorney Kate Mary Murtaugh.  Attorney James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State.  Devonte J Morales appeared by video means with Attorney.  Atty Murtaugh will file a notice of retainer shortly.  Case on for Status Conference.  Court informs def of IDIP equivalent program, pamphlet provided.  Parties approved for Zoom for next hearing.  Def updates- did contact IDIP coordinator, has started the classes and programming.  Status conference scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Status conference on April 7, 2022 at 09:15 am.

10:04 AM Defendant, Devonte J Morales, appeared.  Atty. James Jay Rennicke appeared on behalf of State of Wisconsin.  Def indicates he is working on retaining Kate Murtaugh, needs 2 months to get retainer together.  Case on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Def enters NG pleas.  Discussion of IDIP equivalent program (def Polk Cty resident).  Def instructed to call Justice Coordinator, Tessa Anderson.  Status conference scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Letter from DA re: Copy of summons and complaint to defendant
